alert.note: Alert for Greater Vancouver Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Ice Storm Warning issued January 17 at 7:58AM PST until January 17 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...ICE STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... * WHAT...Significant icing. Additional ice accumulations of a up to 0.05 inch. * WHERE...In Oregon, Greater Portland Metro Area. In Washington, Greater Vancouver Area. * WHEN...Until noon PST today. * IMPACTS...Very slippery sidewalks, roads and bridges are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures remain below freezing, especially in the east metro areas. While rain is beginning to slow, continued rain with these types of temperatures will maintain freezing rain conditions. Temperatures will slowly warm from west to east as the front exits the area and southwesterly flow takes over. Accumulations will vary based on elevation and exposure to the easterly winds.
info.instruction: Travel is strongly discouraged. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power outages. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
